5.title: An Isogonal is a line joining points of:Which point has the geographical coordinates N 44° 33, 2’ and E 20° 59, 0’? (see Figure PPL Nav-4) What is the meaning of the term "drift angle" in navigation?

variants.a: The difference between a direction of the true air speed of an aircraft and a desired track.
variants.b: The angle between an aircraft's longitudinal axis and an actual path.
variants.c: The difference between a magnetic course and a wind direction.
variants.d: The difference between an angle under wind blows to the vector of an actual true air speed and a direction of an aircraft's longitudinal axis.

variants.d: A circle around which the Sun rotates.

variants.d: The equator, meridians and parallels of latitude.

variants.a: Divides the Earth's globe into the north and south hemisphere.
variants.b: Divides the Earth's globe into the east and west hemisphere.

100.title: Which statement is true about homing when using ADF?

variants.a: Homing allows flying along curved path only, which leads to the NDB station.
variants.b: Homing is a practical navigational method, usable for flying to and away from the NDB station.
variants.c: Homing requires an ADF with the automatic or at least manually adjusting compass rose.

124.title: When using a VOR for navigation, station passage is indicated

variants.a: By the first complete reversal of the TO-FROM indicator.
variants.c: When the TO-FROM flag begins to flicker.
variants.d: When the first full-scale deflection of the CDI.

125.title: Which situation would result in reverse sensing of a VOR receiver?

variants.a: Flying a heading that is reciprocal to the bearing selected on the OBS.
variants.b: Setting the OBS to a bearing that is 90° from the bearing on which the aircraft is located.
variants.c: Failing to change the OBS from the selected inbound course to the outbound course after passing the station.

126.title: To track outbound on the 180 radial of a VOR station, the recommended procedure is to set the OBS to

variants.a: 180° and make heading corrections toward the CDI needle.
variants.b: 360° and make heading corrections toward the CDI needle.
variants.c: 180° and make heading corrections away from the CDI needle.

127.title: To track inbound on the 215 radial of a VOR station, the recommended procedure is to set the OBS to

variants.a: 035° and make heading corrections toward the CDI needle.
variants.b: 215° and make heading corrections toward the CDI needle.
variants.c: 215° and make heading corrections away from the CDI needle.

135.title: Which of the following statements, regarding a DME operation, is correct?

variants.a: The frequency of a DME receiver in the aircraft is being adjusted automatically when we set a VOR or ILS frequency.
variants.b: When flying directly above the DME facility, the pilot reads on the DME indicator in the cockpit a zero distance.
variants.c: If we move the DME switch in the cockpit to HOLD, all readings are reset to zero.

variants.c: The distance from the aircraft to a point at the same altitude directly above the DME ground facility.

variants.c: High altitudes and high range from the facility.
